Posts.Content: On 7/16/2008 Pat52 wrote: I was diagnosed with DCIS, stage 1 breast cancer in April of 2006. I had 2 lumpectomies in May and 30 radiation treatments that summer.  From 9/06-6/06, I took arimidex, as recommended by my oncologist.  Weight gain, fatigue, and especially nausea with vomiting were my symptoms during that whole period.  I took myself off of it, but my oncologist convinced me to try aromasin beginning in Dec. of 07.  I have been taking it for 7 months now, and I've never felt so bad daily for so long before.  My first trigger finger developed while on the aromosin.  I have had 2 cortisone shots to help temporarily and only slightly relieve that one.  I have same digit, middle finger, on right hand now, with very limited movement and lots of pain. The pain and stiffness in both hands and feet, is probably the most debilatating symptom for me.  I have trouble walking and using my hands normally.  I too, am so stiff after sitting for even a few minutes or when getting up in the morning, I feel like someone might feel at 100 years old.  My arms and legs hurt, as do my rib area and hips at times.  I go back to my oncologist for a regular check-up in a week, but I am quitting the aromasin TODAY!  My mammogram recently came back clear.  I don't know about the bloodwork yet, until my appt.  My fingers are so swollen.  I am CONSTANTLY tired, regardless of how much sleep I get, which has been about 8-9 hours a night this summer, since I am a teacher.  I rarely have any energy to do anything, but force my self too.  But I also find myself on the couch much of the time, if I really don't HAVE to do anything.  I hate being and feeling like this.  I will post another message in a few weeks to reflect on what I notice about being off the meds.  I'm 52, going on 92! I too took arimidex and had very bad side effects....  I had to quit taking it and start taking tomoxifin.... Had I continued taking the arimidex I would be in a wheelchair by now.... When I took the arimidex I had to have help to get out of bed in the mornings... I hurt so bad... My hands still hurt but nothing like when I took it.... I had to have surgery on my left hand to repair what the arimidex did to them....  I have not talked to anyone that has had good things to say about the arimidex.... I decided to quit it before it killed me instead of the cancer....  I am feeling so much better since I quit it and I cannot believe that it is still out there for people to take.... I hope that things go better for you... Let me know how you are doing.... Lorraine
Posts.Title: side affects of aromasin and arimidex for me

I have NO doubt that it has caused all of my problems..... If I had kept taking it as the doctors wanted, I would of been in a wheel chair...  I wish the best to your Mother....

Posts.Title: Premarin users and lawsuits

Posts.Content: I too took Arimidex for several months following my radiation treatments...  It was the worst that I have ever felt in my life... My hands would not work, my feet hurt so bad in the mornings that I could not get out of bed without holding onto something....  I ended up having hand surgery because it had messed up my joints so bad....  I gained like thirty pounds... After six months I decide that if was the quality of life that I had to live it was not worth it....   The doctor put me on Tamoxifin and things are better....  My hands still hurt a little, but I can live with it... I still cannot lose the weight, but I can at least function as a normal human being, something that I could not do while taking the Arimidex....  I am sure that one reason the doctors are prescribing the Arimidex is because of the price.   It is over $300.00 and the Tamoxifin is like maybe $30.00 a month.... You do know that for every prescription that a doctor prescribes he gets a kickback....  So of course they will prescribe the more expensive ones.... I hope that things are going better for you and your treatments....  Lorraine

Posts.Title: Breast cancer and now a tumor on my Thyroid

Posts.Content: In 2006 I found out that I had breast cancer times two.   I had a partial masectemony followed with radiation....  Since then I have had several scares and had to have biopsies done... Thank God they all came back ok. I had two different MRIs done and when the first one came back my whole report was backwards... I called and told them and I was told that it was a typo.   I had to have another MRI in Jan of this year, and it came back, backwards.... I called and told them that it was also backwards and that I thought the doctor was reading them backwards.....  Well, I was told that yes, in fact he was, the machine had been put together backwards ....  Well, Damn,   I raised some hell over this.  They also found a new tumor with the last MRI, but I was not sure what breast that it was in since everything was backwards.   I called the doctor and told them that I wanted everything sent to a different imaging center .  When I went to them they only did an ultra sound, and said they could not find any new tumors...  All of the reports sent to them from the original center were still backwards and I think that they were very nervous about even getting involved in this mess....  I need some advice on what I should do.   The first doctor sent me a letter and told me that he was very concerned for my health and I needed to go somewhere else and have someone read the MRIs or new ones done.  What should I do????  Lorraine
Posts.Title: Backwards MRI/ I need advice

Posts.Content: I did get a letter from the doctor that did the MRI and he said that he would be willing to pay my out of pocket expenses....  But did not mention any of the new charges from the other facility that did the ultra sounds... I have a appointment this week with my regular doctor and I am going to find out where I should go from here with the new nodule.... I want to get it taken care of and then go after the original doctors... I talked to my nephew who is a lawyer and he told me what to ask for...  He does not deal with these kinds of cases but was a great help in helping me wrtite a letter to the hospital that did the orginal MRIs... It is far from over...  I missed lots of work, drove many miles (180 miles round trip) and lost lots of sleep with worrying...  I cannot believe that a medical facility can be this negilent...  I have been sick with worry....  Thank you for taking the time to answer and for your advice.... Lorraine
Posts.Title: Backwards MRI/ I need advice

Posts.Content: I have had many many mammograms and they smart a little, but believe me, nothing hurts like breast cancer.... The hurt with a mammogram is short lived, the hurt from breast cancer hurts for a long time....  PLEASE get your mammograms !!! Don't listen to the stories about the pain.... Remeber one thing, you might be saving your own life.... Lorraine

Posts.Title: Pain in my joints and muscles

Posts.Content: Hi,   I had  breast cancer in 2006 and I was given Arimedex as a follow up treatment.  My hands and feet hurt so bad that I could hardly get out of bed in the mornings....  I was living on pain meds ....  I finally told my doctor that if this was the quality of life that i would have taking this drug, I would just take my chance ....  I quit and I was then given Tomoxafin....  I feel much better taking it....  I have very little pain in my hands and feet...  I have talked to many women that tried the Arimedex and they all have had the same problems.... It makes me mad that the doctors don't tell us these things....  They like the idea that the Arimedex is like $300.00 for a month.... Tomoxifin is only like $30.00.... A BIG difference...   Take care and Good Luck ~~~~   RainyID
